text: Begin by cutting vegetables. Get that out of the way. Cook your sausage links to about halfway done in a large, high sides sauté pan.  Cook covered for faster cooking and retention of moisture.  Remove sausage from pan keeping fat emitted from sausage in the pan.  Slice sausage into neat ⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) slices. Set aside. Set aside in fridge if you're a slow cook! Warm your broth in a saucepan on medium heat. Return the pan of sausage to heat. Add vegetables: Sauté vegetables in order of thickness. First broccoli, peppers if fresh, then artichokes, onions, garlic. Season with a few pinches of salt and pepper.  Cook for about five minutes then add your rice. Sauté rice for 2 minutes before beginning to add your warm broth. Add the broth in stages. a few ladles worth at a time. Stirring and letting the rice absorb the liquid. Halfway through the cooking of the rice, add your partially cooked turkey sausage -- and add peppers if using frozen. Continue adding broth. After 15 minutes taste your rice to determine doneness. Stop cooking when rice is firm, yet tender.  Remove fry pan from heat and mix in your spices (oregano, thyme, rosemary).  Let sit 2 minutes before serving.  Sprinkle with grated Parmesan or provolone cheese.  Finished.
